_header: As diverse doctors hath writ of the virtue
Note: For a text without introductory Prologue see 6817.
_description: The Virtues of the Mass — twenty-four rhyme royal stanzas with an Envoy of two stanzas rhyme royal and 2 heroic stanzas at the end

BodRawPoe36.First Lines:
As dyuers doctours hath wryt of the vertuIn heryng of the mas &
                    eke of the syght…
BodRawPoe36.Last Lines:
…To here mas As I haue be fore toldThey þat so do shall
                    wyn hevyn
BodRawPoe36.Attributed Title:
Hec sunt dicta sanctorum de virtute sacramenti Altaris. Ac ffructu et
                        effectu Misse provt infra patet (f. 6)
BodRawPoe36.Editions:
Simmons,  Thomas Frederick. 
             The Lay Folks’ Mass Book.
EETS
         o.s. 71 (1879); repr. 1968: 368-70 (portions only).
